statement.p: At a particular temperature and acidity bacillus megaterium will doube every 0.59 hours. Suppose we begin with 1.6 grams of the bacteris. Write an equation for the amount of bacteria after \displaystyle{t} hours.

solution.p: Because the amount doubles every \displaystyle{0.59} hours the number of doublings is \displaystyle\frac{{t}}{{0.59}}. Thus we have \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.59}}}}. The (initial) amount doubled is \displaystyle{1.6}. Thus the model is \displaystyle{b}={1.6}{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.59}}}}\right)}.
